ygData.subject: RE: Anti-charming

ygData.messageBody:
I would not count this as consistent "cheat" without further testing. I
have heard of this many times, but personally haven't been charmed but once,
and that was when I first started playing the game. But I was once in a
group where every person got charmed but me, the monk in the party tried the
sitting trick and it successfully slowed her down. Enough that she didn't
cause too many problems for the rest of the party. But I don't think it
canceled the charm. I feel that further testing is required. Maybe a
couple of people on the list with the ability to charm can try it with some
friends?

On a related note: On that foray against the evil eye.... The other 5
people all got charmed in our group... they started attacking while I was
AFK, so I got there halfway through the battle. I unloaded all my manna at
the eye and successfully killed it. I got an experience message, but nobody
else in the group did. My current theory is that once you are charmed, you
count as a monster, and won't get the experience message for any group kills
during that time. Unfortunately, this is also hard to test. Unfortunately
that mishap resulted in the death of more than half our party... but when I
looked at my XP-o-meter, I got a huge chunk of XP from the fight (if my
theory is correct, I got all of the XP)

-Kzak


-----Original Message-----
When fighting evil eyes in the gorge the other night, I hit the sit button
while charmed somehow. The result was canceling the charm, which allowed me
to continue with my battle. I managed to do this repeatedly throughout the
night. This could be a coincidence or an actual bug in the game, I'm not
sure. Since I felt it was cheating, I quit doing it and left the gorge;
after all, I only wanted another Polished Bone Bracer ;)
